means: [医]〔Andreas Vesalius,1514～1564〕中世纪欧洲佛兰德(Flemish)地方的医师及意大利帕度亚(Padua)城的解剖学教授。1543年出版《人体结构》（七卷）(De humani corporis fabricalibri sep

means.word_mean: 1. a Flemish surgeon who is considered the father of modern anatomy (1514-1564)

auth_sentence.content: Vesalius now left anatomical research to take up medical practice.
auth_sentence.res_content: Vesalius now left anatomical research to take up medical practice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Vesalius now left anatomical research to take up medical practice.

auth_sentence.content: Vesalius was now able make repeated and comparative dissections of humans.
auth_sentence.res_content: Vesalius was now able make repeated and comparative dissections of humans.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Vesalius was now able make repeated and comparative dissections of humans.

auth_sentence.content: However, Vesalius believed that surgery had to be grounded in anatomy.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, Vesalius believed that surgery had to be grounded in anatomy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, Vesalius believed that surgery had to be grounded in anatomy.
